headline: Caesars Entertainment (CZR) Reports Q1 Loss, Tops Revenue Estimates
summary: Caesars Entertainment (CZR) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of -184.21% and 0.50%, respectively, for the quarter ended March 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: Caesars Entertainment posts narrower first-quarter loss on sports betting surge
summary: The Reno, Nevada-based company, which manages online gambling segments, has experienced a surge in its digital segment due to growth in retail sports betting.  Revenue from its digital unit was at $335 million, up from $282 million a year earlier.  Caesars posted a quarterly net loss of $115 million, or 54 cents per share, compared to a loss of $158 million, or 73 cents per share, a year ago.

headline: Caesars Entertainment (NASDAQ:CZR) Reports Q1 In Line With Expectations
summary: Hotel and casino entertainment company Caesars Entertainment (NASDAQ:CZR) met Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q1 CY2025, with sales up 1.9% year on year to $2.79 billion. Its GAAP loss of $0.54 per share was significantly below analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Caesars Entertainment, Inc. Reports First Quarter 2025 Results

headline: Caesars Entertainment Adds Pari-Mutuel Horse Racing to Caesars Sportsbook App in Kentucky and Colorado Ahead of the Kentucky Derby
summary: LAS VEGAS, April 29, 2025--Caesars Entertainment, Inc. (NASDAQ: CZR) today announced it has successfully integrated pari-mutuel horse race wagering into the Caesars Sportsbook app in two U.S. jurisdictions ahead of this year’s Kentucky Derby. Now, horse racing fans in Kentucky and Colorado can conveniently toggle between the elevated sports wagering experience on the Caesars Sportsbook app and the Caesars Racebook wagering interface, powered by NYRA Bets.
